author: Jack Davis
title: Trump Picks Boeing Executive To Be Pentagon’s No. 2 Staffer
text:
— FOX Business (@FoxBusiness) March 16, 2017 
If Shanahan is confirmed by the Senate, he would be required to recuse himself from issues involving Boeing for two years, which is the policy of the Trump administration. 
Trump is also seeking to install David Joel Trachtenberg as the next principal deputy undersecretary of defense for policy. Advertisement - story continues below 
Retired senior diplomat Anne W. Patterson had been under consideration for the post, but her name was withdrawn because of opposition from Sens. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, and Tom Cotton, R-Ark. 
Trachtenberg is the president and CEO of Shortwaver Consulting, a national security consultancy. According to the White House, Trachtenberg was formerly a principal deputy assistant secretary of defense for international security policy. In that role, he oversaw issues relating to NATO, Europe, Russia and Eurasia. 
The president is also appointing Kenneth P. Rapuano as assistant secretary of defense, homeland defense and global security. Rapuano is currently senior VP and director of the studies and analysis group at the ANSER Corporation. During the administration of former President George W. Bush, he was the White House deputy homeland security adviser from 2004-2006. 
Trump also named Robert Daigle of Virginia as director of cost assessment and program evaluation. Daigle was director of program resources and information systems management division in CAPE during the Bush administration. Advertisement - story continues below
